SEARCH:
Package game.AI.Utils

Klasse GameplayAnalysis

java.lang.Object
game.AI.Utils.GameplayAnalysis
public class GameplayAnalysis extends Object
The GameplayAnalysis class is responsible for analyzing gameplay behavior. It uses the AI Player and the AI strategy to make decisions and anticipate possible behavior of opponents.

      public GameplayAnalysis(GameState gameState, int playerNo)
      Constructor for the GameplayAnalysis class.
      Parameter:
      memory -
      difficulty -
      passedForStM -
      player - The player whose gameplay behavior is to be optimized. Typically, this is the artificial intelligence itself, making game decisions.

  • Methodendetails

    • findStMPlayer

      public Player findStMPlayer(Difficulty difficulty)
      Determines if a player is playing "Shoot the Moon" and returns that player.
      Parameter:
      gameState - The current state of the game, containing all relevant information.
      trickwinnable - Indicates if the current trick is winnable.
      Gibt zurück:
      Returns the player who might be playing "Shoot the Moon", otherwise null.

    • shouldPlayForStM

      public boolean shouldPlayForStM(Difficulty difficulty, boolean isPassedForStM)
      Determines whether the AI should pursue the "Shoot the Moon" strategy based on the current game state and other relevant gameplay conditions.
      Parameter:
      gameState - The current state of the game, containing all relevant information.
      playerNo - The player ID of the AI making this decision.
      trickwinnable - Indicates if the current trick is winnable.
      Gibt zurück:
      Returns whether the AI should play "Shoot the Moon".

    • checkForPlayerVoids

      public boolean[][] checkForPlayerVoids(Trick[] allTricks, int tricksPlayed, int tricksToConsider)
      Checks which players may have no more cards in certain suits, based on the tricks played so far.
      Parameter:
      allTricks - An array of all tricks played so far.
      tricksPlayed - The number of tricks played so far.
      memory - The memory setting to determine how many past tricks to consider.
      Gibt zurück:
      A two-dimensional boolean array indicating for each player and each suit whether a void (true) is suspected or not (false).
